31.<center>－ 今期の任務達成目標 －<br>|<left>近年 魔物数の増:
－ Targets for this term －
|In recent years, there has been a noticeable|increase in the number of demons. In order to|eliminate the root of the problem, each of you|
|must find and destroy at least five demon|nests. You are the elite chosen to prevent any|threat to the Royal City Kimbel. Keep this in|
|mind as you go about your duties.

32.ゆっくりと回転する 巨大な装置の中で|不思議な色の かがやく液体が|規則正しく: In the huge, slowly rotating device, a strange|colored glowing liquid seems to be ticking|away time.

33.深夜時間帯の錬金は 錬金釜の作動音が|近隣住民の眠りをさまたげるため 控えましょ: Please refrain from alchemy at night as the|sound may disturb the sleep of the neighbors.|～ Royal City Alchemists Guild

34.指針書への反抗は 罪悪の一種です！|定められた未来は あなたを幸せに導きます。|: Rebellion against the guiding principles is a|form of sin! A predetermined future will lead|you to happiness. Accept everything as it is.

35.ようこそ 栄光のエテーネ王国へ！|時の指針書に記された旅人を 歓迎します。|あな: Welcome to Ethene Kingdom! We welcome the|traveler whose name is written in the Time|Guidebook. May the Goddess bless you.

36.時の指針書に従わぬ者を 発見した場合|国王の権限において すべからく処罰する。|: Anyone found disobeying the Time Guidebook|shall be punished by authority of the King.|～ Guideline Supervisor Belma

37.錬金術師メルクルの店 経営理念|王都キィンベルの 生活に寄りそい|新しい価値を発: Merkul the alchemist's shop is dedicated to|discovering new values and refining the|beautiful culture of the Royal City Kimbel.

38.錬金術師ガンダックの店 経営理念|偉大なる祖先が築きあげた エテーネ王国の|進歩: Gandak the Alchemist's Shop is dedicated to|refining the progress, development, and glory|of Ethene Kingdom, as built by our ancestors.

39.錬金術師 ゼフの店|日用品から魔法生物まで 困った時は|当店へ お気軽に ご相談: Zef the Alchemist's Shop. Please feel free to|contact us if you have any questions from|daily necessities to magical creatures.

40.大きな鐘が 設置されている。|詰所の者たちに 危険を知らせたり|合図を送るのに: There is a large bell.|It seemed to be used to warn and signal the|people in the camp of danger.

41.錬金釜の中で 得体のしれない物が|ぐつぐつ 煮えたぎっている……。: There is something unidentifiable simmering|in the alchemy pot...

42.扉は かたく 閉ざされている。|するどいツメで ひっかいたようなキズあとが|扉の: The door is locked tight!|There were multiple scratches on the door, as|if it had been scratched with sharp claws.

43.王立アルケミアの 入館記録だ。|最後の欄に ヨンゲ所長の名が記されている。: It's a record of entry to the Royal Alchemia.|Director Yong's name is listed in the last|column.

44.誰かの 時の指針書だ。|<pc>は 最後のページを読んだ。<br>|この日 王立:
It's a guidebook for someone else's time.|You read the last page.
|On this day, you will accomplish a feat that|will remain in the history of Royal Alchemia.|You should go about your duties with pride in
|your heart.

45.時の指針書が 落ちている。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|最後のページに:
The Time Guidebook has fallen down.|You read the contents.
|On the last page there was a scrawled sentence in the owner's handwriting.
|Why can't I use the transporter gate! Neither|the attack of the black beast nor the|inability to use the transporter gate are
|mentioned in the guidebook! I can't believe|the Guidebook is useless at a critical moment!|This has never happened to me before in my
|life!

46.時の指針書が 落ちている。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|いかなる 非常事:
The Time Guidebook has fallen down.|You read the contents.
|Never stop the production line in any|emergency situation.
|Don't forget to be grateful.|Thank you for your work.|A heart of gratitude makes life better.

47.ヨンゲ所長の 業務日誌のようだ。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|○月×日。:
It looks like Director Yong's work diary.|You read the contents.
|Month ○ Day ×.|Advanced research area expansion was complete.|The next day, I started alchemizing Gog types.
|Month ○ Day □. Gog type alchemy is finished.|It's a shame to leave all this equipment lying|around, so I'll consider alchemizing a Gog
|type developmental enhancement.
|Month ○ Day △.|After spending the whole day at the Ethene|Royal Manor, I went straight home.

54.子供用の びっくり箱だ。|箱の中の人形が 飛びだしたままだ。: It's a jack-in-the-box for children.|The doll in the box is still popping out.

55.おもちゃの荷車が 放置されている。|部屋を出る直前まで あそんでいたかのようだ。: There is a toy wagon left abandoned.|It was as if they had been playing just before|they left the room.

56.シャンデリアの残骸が 階段をふさいでいる。|２階へ行くのは ムリそうだ……。: The broken chandelier is blocking the stairs.|It's not possible to go to the second floor.

57.シャンデリアの残骸が 階段をふさいでいる。|１階へ降りるのは ムリそうだ……。: The broken chandelier is blocking the stairs.|It's not possible to go down to the first|floor.

58.開きっぱなしの 育児日誌が置いてある。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|○月:
There's a parenting journal left open.|You read the contents.
|Month ○ Day ×. Today my baby called me mama.|It may have been my ears, but that's what it|sounded like to me.
|Month ○ Day △. The baby's crawling has|improved. If I look away for a moment, I find|her in unexpected places, and it can be quite
|scary. The other day, she tried to reach for|the fire in the stove, so I rushed to move her|away. From now on, I have to watch her
|carefully......

59.パドレという人物の 日記のようだ。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|あの日:
It seems to be the diary of a man named Padre.|You read the contents.
|In a drunken stupor that day, my father|mentioned that he wanted me to inherit the|throne, not my brother......
|Since then, my brother has completely shut|down. We had never been close brothers, but|not to the point that we could not speak to
|each other. It may be impossible to repair the|relationship, but I hope he can at least come|and see my newborn child.

80.<center>ようこそ 不死の魔王城へ<br>|<left>勇者アルヴァンさま:
Welcome to the Demon King Castle
|Thank you, Hero Alvan and Ally Kamil, for|coming all the way to the castle of the|Immortal Demon King.
|First of all, I, the General Gladiator Troll,|the steward of Immortal Demon King Nerodos,|will guide you on your journey of death.
|When you are ready to leave this world, please|ascend the stairs and go to the door at the|end to meet me. Hmph.

81.<center>勝利のお祝い<br>|<left>よもや 勇者と盟友ふぜいが|こ:
Congratulations on your victory.
|I never thought that a hero and his ally would|defeat me......! First, let's celebrate your|victory.
|The hospitality we have just shown you is just|the beginning. Please clear your head and|proceed to the door ahead where we, the twelve
|generals of the demon army, await. Hmph.

82.<center>最後のご忠告<br>|<left>なんと 魔軍十二将すらも 打ち:
Final words of advice.
|How dare you defeat even the twelve generals|of the demon army! Your guests must be very|proud of their own strength.
|However, in the inner throne room is the|Immortal Demon King Nerodos. He is the|strongest Demon King who is still undefeated.
|The only thing that awaits you on the other|side of the door is a cruel defeat. If you are|scared, please go back to the entrance through|the travel door in front of you. Gwahaha.

165.大きな鐘が 設置されている。|詰所の者たちに 危険を知らせたり|合図を送るのに: There is a large bell.|It seemed to be used to warn and signal the|people in the camp of danger.

166.食事を作る当番や 掃除をする当番の|予定表が 貼られている。<br>|どうやら:
The schedule for meal preparation and cleaning|duty is posted on the wall.
|Apparently, the security guards are in charge|of the chores at the station on a rotating|basis.

167.<center>－ 今期の任務達成目標 －<br>|<left>近年 魔物数の増:
－ Targets for this term －
|In recent years, there has been a noticeable|increase in the number of demons. In order to|eliminate the root of the problem, each of you|
|must find and destroy at least five demon|nests. You are the elite chosen to prevent any|threat to the Royal City Kimbel. Keep this in|
|mind as you go about your duties.

168.生まれたばかりの 子供のものとおぼしき|ちいさめのベッドだ。: It's a small bed that looks like it belongs to|a newborn child.

169.子供用の びっくり箱だ。|箱の中の人形が 飛びだしたままだ。: It's a jack-in-the-box for children.|The doll in the box is still popping out.

170.子供用の おもちゃの荷車だ。: It's a toy wagon for children.

171.シャンデリアの残骸が 階段をふさいでいる。|２階へ行くのは ムリそうだ……。: The broken chandelier is blocking the stairs.|It's not possible to go to the second floor.

172.シャンデリアの残骸が 階段をふさいでいる。|１階へ降りるのは ムリそうだ……。: The broken chandelier is blocking the stairs.|It's not possible to go down to the first|floor.

173.開きっぱなしの 育児日誌が置いてある。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|○月:
There's a parenting journal left open.|You read the contents.
|Month ○ Day ×. Today my baby called me mama.|It may have been my ears, but that's what it|sounded like to me.
|Month ○ Day △. The baby's crawling has|improved. If I look away for a moment, I find|her in unexpected places, and it can be quite
|scary. The other day, she tried to reach for|the fire in the stove, so I rushed to move her|away. From now on, I have to watch her
|carefully......

174.パドレという人物の 日記のようだ。|<pc>は 中身を読んだ。<br>|あの日:
It seems to be the diary of a man named Padre.|You read the contents.
|In a drunken stupor that day, my father|mentioned that he wanted me to inherit the|throne, not my brother......
|Since then, my brother has completely shut|down. We had never been close brothers, but|not to the point that we could not speak to
|each other. It may be impossible to repair the|relationship, but I hope he can at least come|and see my newborn child.

175.扉を ふさぐようにして 家具が置いてある。|これ以上 進めそうにない。: There is furniture blocking the door.|It seems like you can't proceed any further.

177.暖炉の火が ごうごうと 燃えさかっている。: The fire in the fireplace was roaring.

178.テーブルの上には|おいしそうなフルーツが のっている。: There is delicious looking fruit on the table.

179.とても大きな花瓶が 飾られている。|活けられた花は みずみずしく 美しい。: A very large vase of flowers is on display.|The flowers in the arrangement were fresh and|beautiful.

180.色とりどりの花が かざられた花瓶だ。: It is a vase with colorful flowers in it.

182.チェス盤がある。|しかし コマがないので|チェスで遊ぶことは できなかった！: There is a chessboard.|But you couldn't play chess because you don't|have any pieces!

183.とても大きな花瓶が 飾られている。|活けられた花は みずみずしく 美しい。: A very large vase of flowers is on display.|The flowers in the arrangement were fresh and|beautiful.

184.動力炉内の動力球の光が 明滅を始めたら|交換の合図です。光が 完全に消える前に|:
When the light of the Power Orb in the power|furnace starts to flicker, it's a sign to|replace it.|
|Put in a new Power Orb before it goes out|completely.

185.かわいらしい クマのぬいぐるみが 置いてある。|どうやら とても古いもののようだ: There's a cute stuffed bear on the floor.|It appears to be very old.

186.チェス盤がある。|しかし コマがないので|チェスで遊ぶことは できなかった！: There is a chessboard.|But you couldn't play chess because you don't|have any pieces!

187.極刑に使用された 黄金の釜だ。|生物を黄金に変える機能を そなえているが|今は: It's a golden cauldron used for execution.|It has the ability to turn living things into|gold, but it seems to be deactivated now.

188.鉄格子の扉には カギが かかっている。|脱獄は できないようだ。: The barred door is locked.|There seems to be no way to escape.

189.永久時環が ゆっくりと回転している……。|時渡りのチカラを 使い果たしたので|装: The perpetual time ring is slowly rotating....|The power of time travel has been exhausted,|so the device is empty.

190.未来を担う 見習い錬金術師 募集中！|新しい自分を 始めてみませんか？|: We're looking for apprentice alchemists for|the future! Would you like to start a new you?|～ Royal City Alchemists Guild

191.貼り紙が 乱暴に はがされた跡がある。|「オンディアヌ もう二度と 君を忘れない: A piece of the bulletin board has been roughly|torn off. "Ondian, I will never forget you."|was carved in the corner with a knife.

192.ようこそ 錬金術の都 エテーネ王国へ！|わたしたちは 旅人を歓迎します。|あなた: Welcome to Ethene Kingdom, city of alchemy!|We welcome you, traveler. May the Goddess|bless you with everlasting happiness.

193.ここは 王都のみなさんの いこいの広場です。|マナーを守って 大切に使ってくださ: This is a recreational area for everyone in|the Royal City. Please use with care. Let's|make it a fun and beautiful place forever.

194.錬金術師メルクルの店 経営理念|王都キィンベルの 生活に寄りそい|新しい価値を発: Merkul the alchemist's shop is dedicated to|discovering new values and refining the|beautiful culture of the Royal City Kimbel.

195.錬金術師ガンダックの店 経営理念|偉大なる祖先が築きあげた エテーネ王国の|進歩: Gandak the Alchemist's Shop is dedicated to|refining the progress, development, and glory|of Ethene Kingdom, as built by our ancestors.

196.錬金術師 ゼフの店|日用品から魔法生物まで 困った時は|当店へ お気軽に ご相談: Zef the Alchemist's Shop. Please feel free to|contact us if you have any questions from|daily necessities to magical creatures.

197.ひどく 古びているが|かわいらしい表紙の日記帳が 置いてある。|最後のページには:
There is a diary with a very old but cute|cover. On the last page was written the|following.
|My sweet, sweet baby! May your life be the|most wonderful and the happiest it can be!

198.<left>現在のアトラクションは『クイズ』です！|<left>整理券の配布は: The current attraction is "Quiz"!|Numbered tickets will be distributed here.|Please line up in order during congestion.

199.<center>『おみやげ 販売所』|<center>完売 次回入荷 未定: "Souvenir Shop"|  Sold out. Next shipment to be determined.

200.<left>館内 走るな！|<left>ドルボード厳禁！: No running in the museum!|Dolboard strictly prohibited!

201.<left>この先 療養区画|<left>許可のない市民 立入禁止: Medical area ahead.|Off-limits to Unauthorized Citizens.

204.<center>ようこそ！|<center>宇宙で一番幸福な町 アルウェーンの町: Welcome!|  To Alweyn, happiest town in the universe!|             The entrance is just up ahead.

205.<center>この先 凶悪な魔物が 増加中|<center>進む場合は 慎重に: Increase of vicious monsters ahead.|            Proceed with caution.

207.<left>これは 様々な困難を 乗り越えるため|皆のために 尽力した功績を称え:
This is a statue of Mr. Raguas, made in honor|of his efforts to help everyone overcome|various difficulties.
|However, this statue, which has long been a|symbol of Alweyn, has been ordered to be|destroyed by Eternal Manager, Mr. Pukulas.
|But the statue of Mr. Raguas, who was a great|contributor to Alweyn, could not be neglected,|so it was secretly brought to this small island.
|I hope that one day this statue will return to|Alweyn Town.

208.<left>この先 立入禁止区画|<left>用なき者は 近寄らぬこと: No trespassing zone ahead.|Stay away if you have no business here.

210.<left>この先 研究区画|<left>関係者以外 立入禁止: Research Area ahead|No entry except by authorized personnel.

211.<center>― 船内案内 ―<br>|<center>正面にある 花のような:
― On-board Information ―
|The building in front that looks like a flower|is Alweyn Town as seen from above. The area is|surrounded by a natural heritage reserve.

212.何か 難しい式が 表示されている。: There's a complicated formula on the screen.

214.<center>花壇は 踏み荒らさないでね！|<right>管理 アルウェーン自: Don't trample the flower beds!|～ Management, Alweyn Nature Conservancy

216.<center>ー通達ー|<center>ドルボードによる 衝突事故 多発中|<: ー Notice ー|        Dolboard collisions are common.|        Restricted driving in the lab.

218.<center>ゴミは ちゃんと ゴミ箱へ！: Put your trash in the trash bin!

219.<center>きれいな水で|<center>身も心も きれいに！: Clean Water|         Cleanse your body and soul!

220.<center>ー プクランドの自然 ー<br>|<left>別名 花の民とも:
ー Nature of Pukuland ー
|The Pukulipo people, also known as the Flower|People, live on a beautiful continent surrounded|by flowers and greenery as their name implies.
|Here you will find rare flowers and plants|unique to the continent of Pukland. Specimens|of indigenous monsters are on display.

221.<center>ー プクランドの文化 ー<br>|<left>笑いと 芸を愛した:
ー Culture of Pukuland ー
|The Pukulipo people, with their love of|laughter and art, brought a variety of|cultures and customs to Pukuland Continent.
|In this section, we will introduce some of|them along with the exhibits.

222.<center>！ 取扱い注意 ！|アストルティア博物館 収蔵品|次回 展示入れ: ! Handle with care !|Please keep this in a safe place until it is|displayed in the Astoltia Museum again.

223.<pc>が モニターに触れると|画面に『大いなる目覚め・１』が 表示された。<b:
When you touched the monitor,|"The Great Awakening 1"|appeared on the screen.
|Using my authority as a replicant of the|Eternal Manager, I entered the restricted|area, but found no way to fix the equipment
|malfunction in the cold room. Instead, I found|a cell sample of Multiplying Beast Biologog|that provided the inspiration for the design
|of the infinite power reactor in the|restricted area. Eternal Manager Pukulas is|physically weak. If I can harness the
|multiplying power of the beast's cells,|Pukulas might be able to get healthy. While|I'm looking for a way to repair the cold room,|I'll try it on my body, which has the same
|spirit structure, and if I'm successful, I'll|perform the procedure on Pukulas.

224.<pc>が モニターに触れると|画面に『大いなる目覚め・２』が 表示された。<b:
When you touched the monitor,|"The Great Awakening 2"|appeared on the screen.
|The cells of the Multiplying Beast Biologog|are great. I have more power than a mere|replicant, and more intelligence than even
|Pukulas. Now I can easily repair the cold room|without having to look up the data...... but|I'll have to wait a while before I can wake up
|Pukulas. I want to use the power of the|beast's cells to help my people. To allow|replicants to live without transformation...

225.<pc>が モニターに触れると|画面に『大いなる目覚め・３』が 表示された。<b:
When you touched the monitor,|"The Great Awakening 3"|appeared on the screen.
|The Creator first created the Infinite Power|Reactor, the light of the world...... and then|created the world itself, Alweyn. Finally, he
|created us replicants to serve the primitive|Pukulipo species in this new world. But the|cold room malfunctioned, and as a result, I
|gained the power of a demon beast and learned|the truth about the world. The Creator did not|create us to serve a primitive species. The
|cold room's malfunction was fate. It was the|Creator's way of waking me up. We replicants|are the new masters of Alweyn. Pukulas will
|sleep eternally, and we will rule Alweyn.|......for that is what the Creator desires.

226.<pc>が モニターに触れると|画面いっぱいに 謎の文字列が 表示された。<br:
When you touched the monitor, a mysterious|string of characters filled the screen.
|E-yis, aneu dish cubrey E-yis, aneu dish|cubrey E-yis, aneu dish cubrey E-yis, aneu|dish cubrey....

227.ひどく 古びているが|かわいらしい表紙の日記帳が 置いてある。|最後のページには:
There is a diary with a very old but cute|cover. On the last page was written the|following.
|My sweet, sweet baby! May your life be the|most wonderful and the happiest it can be!

228.<center>開封された手紙が 置いてある……。|どうやら パドレに宛てた も:
There's an open letter on the table......|It appears to be addressed to Padre.|You read the letter.|
| ー To my old friend, Padre. ー|
|I have finally managed to drive the shadow of|the plague from Linjahar. I owe it all to the|jewel you brought me. Therefore, I have|
|decided to hold a banquet soon to celebrate|the restoration. I would like to invite you, a|man of merit, to attend. Let's drink the night|
|away for the first time in a long time. By the|way, I heard that you and your wife had a|long-awaited baby. I can't wait to meet you.|
|I'll be waiting for you and your family in the|land of memories, Linjahar.|～ Loyal friend, Linjara

232.極刑に使用された 黄金の釜だ。|これ以上 魔物は出てこないようだ。: It's a golden cauldron used for execution.|It seems that no more demons will come out.

233.<if_woman>マローネ夫人に宛てられた 手紙だ。|<pc>は 手紙を読んだ:
It's a letter addressed to Mrs. Marone.|You read the letter.
|Is everything all right there? I am surprised|that several months have already passed since|that day. I'm sure your newborn daughter

|daughter. So please bear with me a little|longer.It's a letter addressed to Mrs. Marone.|You read the letter.
|Is everything all right there? I am surprised|that several months have already passed since|that day. I'm sure your newborn son doesn't
|understand what happened to his father. But no|matter how long it takes, I will fulfill the|promise I made to your son. So please bear|with me a little longer.
